title: add/edit/delete specific cookies
body: Both Chrome and Firefox allow developers to manage cookies.Our QA and QE need some cookie editing tools that are more accessible than the console.

comments.body: This is already available. See https://wpdev.uservoice.com/forums/257854-microsoft-edge-developer/suggestions/6700922-cookie-inspection-and-editing

My scenario for needing this is that I ad hoc test a Web application against an account matrix that may include about 4-8 accounts. The account information/session is stored in a cookie for the secure token service. After about 4 users, the cookie can get really long for the particular URL. We may hit the cookie length limit. Chrome allows me to delete the cookies for just that URL. Edge, it doesn't provide me this control. It is all cookies or none.
